metadata.title: CVE-2020-26978 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
Using techniques that built on the slipstream research, a malicious webpagecould have exposed both an internal network's hosts as well as servicesrunning on the user's local machine. This vulnerability affects Firefox <84, Thunderbird < 78.6, and Firefox ESR < 78.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26978` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 84.0+build3-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '84.0+build3-0ubuntu2').
thunderbird package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
